content: using red 6 work even 10 - using white 6 15 work even slip_stitch join and bind off leave a tail about 8 long so you can sew the legs to the body do not stuff the rest of the leg sew legs to body at the front / bottom of the body see pictures page 4 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com visor for helmet row instruction stitches 1 using gray 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 bind off leaving a long to use to sew the visor hole to the helmet later on backpack row instruction stitches this part is worked in an oval not a circle do not use a magic_ring 1 chain 6 in the 2nd chain from the hook work 2 single_crochet single_crochet in the next 3 single_crochet 14 4 single_crochet in last chain working on the back side of the chain now single_crochet in next 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in last chain 2 in blo single_crochet in each single_crochet around 14 3 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 14 8 9 using red you do not need to cut your white yarn 14 work even 10 picking the white yarn back up 14 work even 11 working in blo 1 decrease 3 single_crochet 1 decrease 1 decrease 3 single_crochet 1 decrease 10 bind off leaving a long tail stuff the back pack and use the tail to close up the hole at the top of the backpack then use the tail to sew the backpack to the back of the astronaut later on oxygen tubes make 2 using white chain 16 attach tube to the back pack by slip stitching somewhere near the top or side of the back pack now slip_stitch into each chain back down to where you started bind off use the two tails to tie the tube to the front of the astronaut hide the tail ends inside page 5 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together here are all the parts laying out together i always start with sewing the head and body together first since you bound off both pieces with 12 stitches you should have no trouble getting them to go together perfectly the i sew the arms one row below the shoulder between the 2nd and 3rd row i put the arm with the stripes on his left page 6 of 10 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com next i put on his legs i wanted him to stand up so i stuffed his legs all the way up to the top if you want your astronaut to sit down just stuff his feet but not his whole leg so he bends easily at the hip some more views of the legs in place page 7 of 10 copyright by sherri
